task.title: Specifying read-write for existing buckets
task.shortdesc: The number of readers and writers can be changed for existing data buckets: Data Buckets > Data bucket drop-down > Disk Read-Write Concurrency.

context.p: After a bucket has been created, the reader/writer setting can be changed. After changing the setting for a bucket, the bucket is re-started and goes through server warmup before the bucket becomes available.

step.stepresult: A table with all data buckets in your cluster appears.

step.cmd: Click the drop-down next to your data bucket.
step.stepresult: General information about the bucket appears as well as controls for the bucket.
A Configure Bucket panel appears where the reader-writer setting is changed.

step.cmd: Under the Disk Read-Write Concurrency section, enter a number of readers and writers.

step.stepresult: A warning appears indicating that this change recreates the data bucket.

step.info: The Data Buckets tab appears and the named bucket displays with a yellow or green indicator. A yellow indicator means that the bucket is recreated and is warming up. A green indicates means that the bucket has completed warmup. At this point, the bucket is ready to receive and serve requests.
